attributes.action: A statue of HM Queen Elizabeth II to be erected in Trafalgar square.
attributes.additional_details: Her Majesty is the longest-reigning monarch in British history and is held in the highest esteem by the people of this country. A statue in Trafalgar square would be a fitting memorial to Her Majesty, available for all to see in a prominent position in the capital.
attributes.background: A statue of Her Majesty should be commissioned and raised in this prominent place, if necessary by public subscription, as a permanent memorial to Her Majesty.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

Decisions about what is displayed on Trafalgar Square is a matter for the Mayor of London and London Assembly, not the Government or House of Commons.

We currently have the below petition open which you might like to sign:
Fund the creation of a suitable monument to Elizabeth the Second.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623549
